text2.content: The Falkland Island consist for 40 percent of peatlands, which makes is one of the most peat rich places in the world. Peat or turf is an accumulation of partially decayed vegetation or organic matter and are the largest natural terrestrial carbon store.This puts the Falkland Island in a particularly unique position to benefit richly from restoration; it could save up to 1 million tons of CO2 emissions a year.

text3.content: Which countries are among the world’s top CO2 polluters per capita?

text4.content: The oil producing nations in the Middle East, particularly those with small populati-ons, such as Qatar and the United Arab Emirates, rank among the world’s wealthiest 	nations but they also rank among the world’s highest polluters per capita CO2 emissions. Though, they are often lost in the global warming debate.

text5.content: Estonia’s CO2 emission consists for more than 90 percent of burning oil shale for electricity. The high concentrations of pollutants lead to respiratory diseases among children.

text6.content: Turkmenistan's methane pollution should be a significant concern for the rest of the planet.Methan is the most abundant component of natural gas and energy plants in Turkmenistan are leaking methane in huge quantities.

texts.content: CO2 emissions in tons per capita of top 20 countries split by continent.

The Falkland Island consist for 40 percent of peatlands, which makes is one of the most peat rich places in the world. Peat or turf is an accumulation of partially decayed vegetation or organic matter and are the largest natural terrestrial carbon store.This puts the Falkland Island in a particularly unique position to benefit richly from restoration; it could save up to 1 million tons of CO2 emissions a year.
Which countries are among the world’s top CO2 polluters per capita?

The oil producing nations in the Middle East, particularly those with small populati-ons, such as Qatar and the United Arab Emirates, rank among the world’s wealthiest 	nations but they also rank among the world’s highest polluters per capita CO2 emissions. Though, they are often lost in the global warming debate.
Estonia’s CO2 emission consists for more than 90 percent of burning oil shale for electricity. The high concentrations of pollutants lead to respiratory diseases among children.

Turkmenistan's methane pollution should be a significant concern for the rest of the planet.Methan is the most abundant component of natural gas and energy plants in Turkmenistan are leaking methane in huge quantities.
